title: David Carter (golfer)
text:
David Malcolm Carter (born 16 June 1972) is an <a href="England">English</a> <a href="golf">golf</a>er.
Carter was born in <a href="Johannesburg">Johannesburg</a>, <a href="South%20Africa">South Africa</a>, and represented his country of birth at junior level. He later moved to England and turned professional in 1989. After several visits to <a href="qualifying%20school">qualifying school</a> he had his rookie season on the <a href="European%20Tour">European Tour</a> in 1995. His best season was 1998, when he won the <a href="Murphy%27s%20Irish%20Open">Murphy's Irish Open</a>, which remains his only official money victory on the tour, and finished 19th on the Order of Merit. However he is probably best known for winning that year's <a href="World%20Cup%20of%20Golf">World Cup</a> for England in partnership with <a href="Nick%20Faldo">Nick Faldo</a>. He also won the 1996 Indian PGA Championship.
In March 1997 Carter almost lost his life when he required emergency brain surgery after collapsing in his hotel in <a href="Dubai">Dubai</a>.
Carter moved to the Czech Republic in 2008. In April 2010, he opened his first golf academy at the Albatross Golf Course – David Carter Albatross Golf Academy.
Professional wins (3).
European Tour wins (1).
